p:
At day-5 post-challenged with H1N1 or H3N2, oropharyngeal swabs and lungs of the mice were collected, homogenized, and clarified. The viral RNA in the lung supernatants and oropharyngeal swabs was extracted using the RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) and reverse transcribed using the RevertAid H Minus Reverse Transcriptase (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Specific primers (Forward primer: 5′-AAGACCAATCCTGTCACCTCTGA-3′; and Reverse primer: 5′-CAAAGCGTCTACGCTGCAGTCC-3′) which anneal to the matrix gene of IAV and the quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) conditions were adapted from Hopkins et al. [ 29]. The viral RNA copy number was determined by absolute quantification using a standard curve and calculated using Equation (1).
